titleInfo.title: Did I Ever Have a Chance?

mods.note: The artist; Estate of Martin Wong, 1999; The Martin Wong Foundation (P.P.O.W Gallery, New York), 2017

“Julie Ault/Heinz Peter Knes/ Danh Vo/ Martin Wong: Neptune Society, San Francisco Columbarium, 4th FL, Dome Room, South Wall, Tier 4, Niche 2” (group exhibition), Galerie Buchholz, Berlin, November 30, 2012–January 19, 2013
“Abandon the Parents,” (group exhibition), Statens Museum for Kunst, Copenhagen, May 23–September 28, 2014
“Did I Ever Have a Chance?” (group exhibition), Gordon Robichaux and Marc Selwyn Fine Art, Los Angeles, August 15–September 19, 2020

“Martin Wong: Malicious Mischief,” Museo Centro de Arte Dos de Mayo (CA2M), Madrid, November 8, 2022–January 29, 2023; KW Institute for Contemporary Art, Berlin, February 25–May 14, 2023; Camden Art Centre, London, June 8–September 17, 2023; Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam, November 3, 2023–April 1, 2024
Krist Gruijthuijsen and Augustín Pérez Rubio, eds., Martin Wong: Malicious Mischief, exh. cat. (Cologne: Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther und Franz König, 2022), 156, 280, 323.

Kristina Foster, “Martin Wong at Berlin’s KW Institute Review—California Psychedelia Meets Asian Mysticism,” Financial Times, May 2, 2023, https://www.ft.com/content/f748ffa0-125b-414c-a8fd-6250b93cc2ba?accessToken=zwAF-ryDuDswkdP3SP-gEltBTNOo_WJQuTzCug.MEUCIERYAppduvtdOBE8BymU1An2QgzhxK_s13l59utFHiR1AiEAy2TVTxvdwmRLZOSau6xxkybH-TpqPBz-tYLIkoVSG3E&sharetype=gift&token=d13b136b-b62a-4595-9378-0dd3ecaa87fe.
Martin Herbert, “Martin Wong: Malicious Mischief,” Art in America 111, no. 3 (Summer 2023): 135.
Madeleine Pollard, “The Queer Chinese American Artist Who Captured the Underbelly of 80s NY,” i-D Magazine – VICE, April 12, 2023, https://i-d.vice.com/en/article/k7z8an/martin-wong-artist.
Gianandrea Poletta, “Tales from the Gutter: Martin Wong’s ‘Malicious Mischief’ at KW, Berlin,” Nero, May 18, 2023, https://www.neroeditions.com/tales-from-the-gutter/.

Emily Steer, “Martin Wong’s Paintings Are an Ethereal Explanation of Otherness,” AnOther Magazine, June 21, 2023, https://www.anothermag.com/art-photography/14949/martin-wong-malicious-mischief-camden-art-centre.
Dylan Huw, “The Many Lives of Martin Wong,” ArtReview, June 27, 2023, https://artreview.com/martin-wong-malicious-mischief-camden-art-centre-london-review/.
Joe Lloyd, “Martin Wong: Malicious Mischief,” Studio International, June 28, 2023, https://www.studiointernational.com/index.php/martin-wong-malicious-mischief-review-camden-art-centre-london.

Sam Moore, “Prisoners, cruising and Bruce Lee: how the world caught up with artist Martin Wong,” The Guardian, August 22, 2023, https://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2023/aug/22/prisoners-cruising-and-bruce-lee-how-the-world-caught-up-with-artist-martin-wong.
Phoebe Cripps, “Martin Wong: ‘Malicious Mischief,’ Camden Art Centre, London,” Flash Art, 344 (Fall 2023): 43.

mods.accessCondition: Images of Martin Wong’s work presented here can be reproduced for use in research, teaching, and private study only. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from The Martin Wong Foundation, the owners of the rights to these images.
